column1: #Text=Cancer charity fundraiser and blogger Stephen Sutton dies aged 19
#Text=United Kingdom blogger and cancer charity fundraiser Stephen Sutton has died today at the age of 19 .

#Text=Sutton , himself a cancer sufferer , gained media attention in the UK for his fundraising activities for Teenage Cancer Trust , which have raised more than £ 3.3 million ( US$ 5.5 million or € 4 million ) for the charity .
#Text=Sutton 's original goal was £10,000 ( US$ 16,800 or € 12,200 ) for the charity .
#Text=His mother said he died in his sleep during the early hours of this morning .
#Text=Stephen Sutton was the most inspiring person I 've ever met and touched more lives than he will ever know — Jason Manford , comedian
#Text=Sutton 's mother broke the news in a post on '
#Text=Stephen 's story ' , the Facebook page launched in January 2013 in which Sutton documented events in his life .
#Text=" My heart is bursting with pride but breaking with pain for my courageous , selfless , inspirational son " , she wrote .

#Text= Stephen Sutton was the most inspiring person I 've ever met and touched more lives than he will ever know " , he said .

column1: #Text=" He was an incredibly positive young man and a credit to his family , to Burntwood and to humanity itself .
